intro: Pouzolzia mixta var. shirensis, commonly known as the Shirensis pouzolzia, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Polygonaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, ovate leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of pubescence. The plant produces clusters of greenish-white flowers, which are borne in dense, compact inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
